reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty, File 10 of 14
title: BT Tymnet
historical_context: This article is part of a series detailing access points and services of British Telecom's Tymnet network, which was significant in the early 1990s for providing global data communication services.
target_audience: Hackers, telecommunications enthusiasts, and security professionals.
short_summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of access points and services available through British Telecom's Tymnet network, including a detailed index of access locations and service classifications across various regions.
summary: In this final part of the BT Tymnet series, Toucan Jones presents an extensive index of access points for the BT-GNS (Global Network Services) across various countries. The article meticulously categorizes nodes by city, state, and country, providing essential details such as access numbers and modem compatibility. This information is crucial for users looking to connect to the Tymnet network, which was a vital resource for data communication during its time. The article also highlights the different service classifications available for database or timesharing companies utilizing Tymnet, showcasing the network's global reach and versatility in supporting diverse telecommunications needs. Overall, this piece serves as a valuable reference for anyone interested in the historical landscape of telecommunications and data access.
